channel.title: What computer should i get?
channel.description:
hey my dad finally decided to get me a new computer and he said i could spend up to 4.5kNZD(new zealand dollars). i am not to sure what kinda computer i should get but i wana get a real good machine that will last a few years and be able to run all the latest games.
i am asking you what kind i should get as i dont know alot about computers :( i know a bit but not much.
so can anyone recomended any great computers for around that price or a good computer brand i am looking a dell and hp currently but if you know any other brands that a better please let me know as well
thanks

item.title: What computer should i get?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If you can put together a Lego set with more than 10 pieces, and know how to work a philips screwdriver, you are fully qualified to snap together your own computer. That is the level of complexity we are talking about, do you think you can handle it?

Read full topic

item.title: What computer should i get?
item.dc:creator: @serpento serpento
item.description:
@serpento wrote:

If you really don’t know much about computers, don’t build one, trust me. Just buy one, if you live in new zealand, I really don’t know what good brans they have there.

And if you’re into high performance gaming, a good RAM, processor and a Graphic Card would do. Good graphic cards uses AGP and PCI-Express slots, PCI are not that good. Make sure the computer you’re getting can support AGP or PCI-E(express), all computers should have PCI slots, but those slots are just for sound cards, and other things such as extra USB ports, etc.

If you’re planning to build a computer, It’s cheaper but you’re going to have to face the fact of buying a motherboard, windows xp/vista, power supply box, hard drives, ram, procesor, CD drive, and configuring the drivers and the installing the windows it would be a pain…

Dell offers good computers, but mostly all there computers only comes with PCI slots, HP is a very good brand aswell(don’t know much about those, but there good).

If you’re getting a laptop, make sure theres a good graphic card in it, because you cant buy one separately and add it later, and some good RAM(about 1GB+).

What kind of games are you talking about? Runescape? doesn’t really require anything… BattleField 2, World of Warcraft, Counter Strike, etc does. Go to the game website and see the requirements it needs in order to run…

Hopes this helps, if you need anymore questions, just give me a pm

Read full topic

item.title: What computer should i get?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“nator123123, post:3, topic:73611”]DO NOT GET AN E-MACHINE COMPUTER, THEY ARE BAD!!!
Gateway is okay too, but Dell Core is better. Dell Core is a good gamer.[/quote]

E-machine and gateway are the exact same company, and both are good. My laptop is an emachine and I have never had any problems at all out of it.

But for a desktop, you definitely want to build your own, everything else is way over priced.

item.title: What computer should i get?
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

A desktop, lol.
Dell Core with EXCELLENT RAM, hardrive, and ESPECIALLY AN EXCELLENT GRAPHICS CARD (A MUST). Try XP or Vista. I reccomend vista because it looks cooler, and you are able to see your graphic ratings on it. But usually XP holds more tricks. Some people say XP is better gamer than vista, but I think they are equal.
I have a Toshiba and an Acer, both laptops.

DO NOT GET AN E-MACHINE COMPUTER, THEY ARE BAD!!!
Gateway is okay too, but Dell Core is better. Dell Core is a good gamer.

Read full topic
